title: Future Transcendent Saga Appendix III "Limbo To Infinity"
historical_context: This article provides insights into the early days of internet and Bitnet connectivity, highlighting the transition and interaction between different networking protocols.
target_audience: Network administrators, hackers, security professionals, and anyone interested in the history of internet networking.
short_summary: The article details the gateways between Bitnet and the Internet, explaining how mail is routed between different networks. It includes a comprehensive list of domains, their corresponding names, and gateways for various institutions.
summary: In this article, Henry Nussbacher compiles a detailed list of gateways that facilitate communication between Bitnet and the Internet. The document serves as a crucial resource for understanding how different networks interact, particularly during a time when the Internet was still in its infancy. The author explains the significance of domain names and routing designations, emphasizing the importance of proper configuration for mail transport across networks. The article also provides a structured table that categorizes various domains, including commercial, academic, and government clients, along with their respective gateways and descriptions. This information is vital for network administrators and users navigating the complexities of early internet communications, showcasing the foundational elements that would shape modern networking.
